messages.title: YOUR TOP CANDIDATE
messages.content: Alison Johnstone is 45 and has lived in Edinburgh all her life, now with her husband and daughter. She has been a Green councillor in the city since 2007, and is a keen runner.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: GO PLASTIC BAG FREE IN LOTHIAN
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaigning to go plastic bag free, where individual villages in Lothian have now won the title 'Heritage Green Retown'.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: FIX THE FORTH ROAD BRIDGE, SAVE BILLIONS FOR PUBLIC SERVICES
keyPolicies.policyDescription: A new road bridge over the Forth would cost £2.3 billion while the existing bridge could be fixed for £120 million. Alison wants to invest the difference in public services like schools, housing and transport.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: BOOST TO LOCAL PROJECTS FROM GREENS' CLIMATE CHALLENGE FUND
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Green MSPs have won £37 million for community projects to tackle climate change. Alison last local residents to talk about one such project, Shandon Local Food Group, with its 'Shop Local' campaign.
Fairer taxes to invest in public services. Green taxes to pollute less and save energy. No fees - keep tuition free. Cut fuel bills, insulate every home.

issues.economy: Alison wants to invest the difference in public services like schools, housing and transport.
issues.education: Fairer taxes to invest in public services.
issues.environment: Campaigning to go plastic bag free, where individual villages in Lothian have now won the title 'Heritage Green Retown'. Green MSPs have won £37 million for community projects to tackle climate change.

housing.content: A new road bridge over the Forth would cost £2.3 billion while the existing bridge could be fixed for £120 million. Alison wants to invest the difference in public services like schools, housing and transport.

leaflet.personalStatement: With your support I can continue Robin Harper's work as your new Green MSP for Lothian.

images.caption: Alison Johnstone with supporters and local residents.
Boost to local projects from Greens' Climate Challenge Fund.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Alison is a competitive runner and is passionate about protecting Edinburgh's precious green spaces.
